snippet: With broader legislation stalled in Congress, the Obama administration announced plans to allow the spouses of some highly skilled temporary immigrants to work in the United States.
abstract: Obama administration, looking to make adjustments to nation’s immigration system while broader legislation is stalled in Congress, announces plans to allow spouses of some highly skilled temporary immigrants to work in United States; proposals address visa rules that have long caused difficulties for spouses of skilled immigrants.
lead_paragraph: With broader legislation stalled in Congress, the Obama administration announced plans to allow the spouses of some highly skilled temporary immigrants to work in the United States.

headline.main: U.S. Plan Aims to Draw Immigrants With Technology Skills
headline.print_headline: Plan Aimed at Drawing Immigrants With Technology Skills
